repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Rewrite the string storage to use compressed concatenated strings and an index to slice them into the final user strings.
Allow users to chose between zlib and bzip2 compression.

Supersedes https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/6969

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    compressed_bytes = PyMemoryView_FromMemory(s, length, PyBUF_READ);
```

should avoid copying `s` I think.
Turns out, it's useless to create a bytes object (or memoryview) from a `char*` just to extract the `char*` from it again. :)

```suggestion
    # Note: order is important and defines values for "CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS" !
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -30,6 +32,43 @@
 from ..StringIOTree import StringIOTree
 
 
+# Set up available compression algorithms for maximum compression.
+from zlib import compress as zlib_compress
+try:
+    from bz2 import compress as bz2_compress
+except ImportError:
+    bz2_compress = None
+else:
+    bz2_compress = partial(bz2_compress, compresslevel=9)
+#try:
+#    from lzma import compress as lzma_compress
+#except ImportError:
+#    lzma_compress = None
+try:
+    from compression.zstd import (
+        compress as zstd_compress,
+        CompressionParameter as zstd_CompressionParameter,
+        Strategy as zstd_Strategy,
+    )
+except ImportError:
+    zstd_compress = None
+else:
+    zstd_compress = partial(zstd_compress, options={
+        zstd_CompressionParameter.strategy: zstd_Strategy.btultra2,
+        zstd_CompressionParameter.compression_level: zstd_CompressionParameter.compression_level.bounds()[1],
+    })
+
+compression_algorithms = [
+    # Note: order is important and defines valiues for "CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS" !

comment_data.body: Do we potentially need `split_string_literal` too? Or has MSVC improved at some point? (It looks like C99 might impose a requirement of 4095 even if most compilers do better)

@@ -1902,87 +1952,126 @@ def normalise_encoding_name(py_string):

                 decls_writer.putln("#endif")
 
+        # Generate stringtab and Python string constants.
+        py_string_count = len(py_bytes_consts) + len(py_unicode_consts)
+        self.parts['module_state'].putln(f"PyObject *{Naming.stringtab_cname}[{py_string_count}];")
+        self._generate_module_array_traverse_and_clear(Naming.stringtab_cname, py_string_count, may_have_refcycles=False)
+
+        stringtab_offset = 0

+        stringtab_offset = len(py_bytes_consts)
+        self.generate_pystring_constants(py_unicode_consts, stringtab_offset, is_unicode=True)
+
+    def generate_pystring_constants(self, py_strings: list, stringtab_pos: cython.Py_ssize_t, is_unicode: bool):
+        # Concatenate strings and build index array.
         if not py_strings:
             return
 
-        py_strings.sort()

-            const unsigned short n;

-            const unsigned char encoding;
-        #elif %(num_encodings)d <= 65535
-            const unsigned short encoding;
-        #else
-            const Py_ssize_t encoding;
-        #endif
-            const unsigned int is_unicode : 1;
-            const unsigned int intern : 1;
-        } __Pyx_StringTabEntry;
-        """ % dict(
-            max_length=longest_pystring,
-            num_encodings=len(encodings),
-        )))
-
-        py_string_count = len(py_strings)
-        self.parts['module_state'].putln(f"PyObject *{Naming.stringtab_cname}[{py_string_count}];")
-        self._generate_module_array_traverse_and_clear(Naming.stringtab_cname, py_string_count, may_have_refcycles=False)
+        w = self.parts['init_constants']
+        defines = self.parts['constant_name_defines']
+
+        index = []
+        string_values = []
+        max_length: cython.Py_ssize_t = 1
+        first_interned: cython.Py_ssize_t = -1
+        stringtab_group_start = stringtab_pos
+
+        for i, (is_interned, cname, text) in enumerate(py_strings):
+            string_value = text if is_unicode else text.byteencode() if text.encoding else text.utf8encode()
+            length = len(string_value)
+            if length > max_length:
+                max_length = length
+            if is_interned and first_interned == -1:
+                first_interned = i
+            index.append("{%d}" % length)
+            string_values.append(string_value)
+
+            defines.putln(f"#define {cname} {Naming.stringtab_cname}[{stringtab_pos}]")
+            stringtab_pos += 1
+
+        if is_unicode:
+            concat_bytes = ''.join(string_values).encode('utf8')
+        else:
+            concat_bytes = b''.join(string_values)
 
-        encodings = sorted(encodings)
-        encodings.sort(key=len)  # stable sort to make sure '0' comes first, index 0
-        assert not encodings or '0' not in encodings or encodings[0] == '0', encodings
-        encodings_map = {encoding: i for i, encoding in enumerate(encodings)}
-        w.putln("static const char * const %s[] = { %s };" % (
-            Naming.stringtab_encodings_cname,
-            ', '.join(encodings),
-        ))
-
-        w.putln("static const __Pyx_StringTabEntry %s[] = {" % Naming.stringtab_cname)
-        for n, (c_cname, _, py_string) in enumerate(py_strings):
-            encodings_index = encodings_map[normalise_encoding_name(py_string)]
-            is_unicode = py_string.is_unicode
-
-            self.parts['constant_name_defines'].putln("#define %s %s[%s]" % (
-                py_string.cname,
-                Naming.stringtab_cname,
-                n))
-
-            w.putln("{%s, sizeof(%s), %d, %d, %d}, /* PyObject cname: %s */" % (
-                c_cname,
-                c_cname,
-                encodings_index,
-                is_unicode,
-                py_string.intern,
-                py_string.cname
-                ))
-        w.putln("{0, 0, 0, 0, 0}")
-        w.putln("};")
-
-        self.use_utility_code(UtilityCode.load_cached("InitStrings", "StringTools.c"))
+        w.putln("{")
 
-        init_constants = self.parts['init_constants']
-        init_constants.putln(
-            "if (__Pyx_InitStrings(%s, %s, %s) < 0) %s;" % (
-                Naming.stringtab_cname,
-                init_constants.name_in_main_c_code_module_state(Naming.stringtab_cname),
-                Naming.stringtab_encodings_cname,
-                init_constants.error_goto(self.module_pos)))
+        # index of string offsets
+        w.putln(
+            "const struct { "
+            f"const unsigned int length: {max_length.bit_length()}; "
+            "} "
+            f"index[] = {{{','.join(index)}}};",
+        )
+
+        # string data
+        self.use_utility_code(UtilityCode.load_cached("DecompressString", "StringTools.c"))
+
+        has_if = False
+        for algo_number, algo_name, compress in compression_algorithms:
+            if compress is None:
+                continue
+            compressed_bytes = compress(concat_bytes)
+            if len(compressed_bytes) >= len(concat_bytes) - 10:
+                continue
+
+            guard = "__PYX_LIMITED_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030e0000" if algo_name == 'zstd' else "1"
+            w.putln(f"#{'if' if not has_if else 'elif'} CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS == {algo_number} && ({guard}) /* {algo_name} */")
+            has_if = True
+            escaped_bytes = StringEncoding.escape_byte_string(compressed_bytes)
+            w.putln(f'const char* const cstring = "{escaped_bytes}";', safe=True)
+            w.putln(f'PyObject *data = __Pyx_DecompressString(cstring, {len(compressed_bytes)}, {algo_number});')
+            if is_unicode:
+                w.putln('PyObject *str_data = PyUnicode_FromEncodedObject(data, "UTF-8", NULL);')
+                w.putln("Py_DECREF(data); data = str_data;")
+            else:
+                w.putln('const char* const bytes = __Pyx_PyBytes_AsString(data);')
+                w.putln("#if !CYTHON_ASSUME_SAFE_MACROS")
+                w.putln(f'if (likely(bytes)); else {{ Py_DECREF(data); {w.error_goto(self.module_pos)} }}')
+                w.putln('#endif')
+
+        if has_if:
+            w.putln("#else")
+        escaped_bytes = StringEncoding.escape_byte_string(concat_bytes)
+        w.putln(f'const char* const cstring = "{escaped_bytes}";', safe=True)

comment_data.body: I still think this might be worthwhile - I think you've made some changes to the output in light of this, but this suggestion was on the input?

I think the current behaviour is to fall back to uncompressed if the user specifies `CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS==3` and it isn't available.  That seems reasonable and I don't think more customization is needed.

If that's right it might be worth compiling it anyway just to check that it does fallback to something compilable.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,246 @@
+# mode: run
+
+"""
+PYTHON -c "'py'; import module; assert len(module.__doc__) == 1297, len(module.__doc__)"
+
+PYTHON setup_zlib.py build_ext --inplace --force
+PYTHON -c "'zlib'; import module; assert len(module.__doc__) == 1297, len(module.__doc__)"
+
+PYTHON setup_bz2.py build_ext --inplace --force
+PYTHON -c "'bz2'; import module; assert len(module.__doc__) == 1297, len(module.__doc__)"
+
+PYTHON setup_zstd.py build_ext --inplace --force
+PYTHON -c "'zstd'; import module; assert len(module.__doc__) == 1297, len(module.__doc__)"
+
+PYTHON setup_uncompressed.py build_ext --inplace --force
+PYTHON -c "'uncompressed'; import module; assert len(module.__doc__) == 1297, len(module.__doc__)"
+
+PYTHON setup_default.py build_ext --inplace --force
+PYTHON -c "'default'; import module; assert len(module.__doc__) == 1297, len(module.__doc__)"
+
+PYTHON check_source.py
+"""
+
+######## check_source.py ########
+
+algorithms = {}
+
+with open("module.c") as f:
+    for line in f:
+        if ' CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS == ' not in line or ' /* ' not in line:
+            continue
+
+        _, rest = line.split(' CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS == ')
+        config_value, rest = rest.split(' && ')
+        _, algo_name = rest.split(' /* ')
+
+        algorithms[int(config_value)] = algo_name.rstrip(' */\n')
+
+assert algorithms[1] == 'zlib', algorithms
+assert algorithms[2] == 'bz2', algorithms
+assert algorithms.get(3) in ('zstd', None), algorithms
+
+assert len(algorithms) in (2, 3), algorithms
+
+with open("short_text.c") as f:
+    for line in f:
+        assert ' CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS == ' not in line, line
+
+
+######## setup_default.py ########
+
+from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
+from setuptools import setup, Extension
+
+setup(
+    ext_modules=cythonize(["module.py", "short_text.py"]),
+)
+
+
+######## setup_uncompressed.py ########
+
+from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
+from setuptools import setup, Extension
+
+setup(ext_modules=cythonize([
+    Extension("*", sources=["module.py"], define_macros=[('CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS', '0')]),
+    Extension("*", sources=["short_text.py"], define_macros=[('CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS', '0')]),
+]))
+
+
+######## setup_zlib.py ########
+
+from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
+from setuptools import setup, Extension
+
+setup(ext_modules=cythonize([
+    Extension("*", sources=["module.py"], define_macros=[('CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS', '1')]),
+    Extension("*", sources=["short_text.py"], define_macros=[('CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS', '1')]),
+]))
+
+
+######## setup_bz2.py ########
+
+from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
+from setuptools import setup, Extension
+
+setup(ext_modules=cythonize([
+    Extension("*", sources=["module.py"], define_macros=[('CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS', '2')]),
+    Extension("*", sources=["short_text.py"], define_macros=[('CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS', '2')]),
+]))
+
+
+######## setup_zstd.py ########
+
+from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
+from setuptools import setup, Extension
+
+try:
+    import compression.zstd
+except ImportError:
+    pass

comment_data.body: Ah, right. I had missed the actual spot where you put this comment. Good idea, done.

It might be worth generating our own improved error message here. Right now if it fails it'll just give an `ImportError` pointing to the first line of the Cython file, which isn't great for a user that wants to debug/fix it themselves. 

(There's probably a few limited API places where I should do the same too, but that's a separate issue)

So … you are suggesting to add a new string explaining that we failed to do something that we only do to reduce the space occupied by strings in the module? :o]

I'm not sure if it adds that much compared to a plain `ImportError`, but ok, I'll add a message with more context.

I was mainly thinking about pointing them to a solution in `CYTHON_COMPRESS_STRINGS`.

(My guess is that missing standard-library modules may come up slightly more often that we'd first think from people embedding the Python interpreter in an executable)

commit.message: Generate a zlib compressed copy of long Python Unicode strings  and (optionally but by default) use it in the binary module instead of the uncompressed version.
Exclude test file from codespell check.
Rewrite the string storage to use compressed concatenated strings and an index to slice them into the final user strings.
Exclude compression variants that grow the data instead of shrinking it.
Fix test that assumed strings to be separate in the C code.
Avoid useless back and forth object creations.
Avoid special case for interned Unicode strings.
Adapt test to older Python versions.
Always include zstd code generation in the tests even if it's not available.
Avoid copying the compressed data on decompression.
Adapt PyMemoryView_FromMemory() call to various constraints.
Reverse the algorithm chain to keep "zlib" as the "I want compression" fallback if the selected algorithm isn't available.
Add some context to the error message when failing to import a compression module.
Add even more context to the error message when failing to import a compression module.

Refactor the string storage and initialisation to use a single (compressed) byte string for both Unicode and bytes strings.
This may allow better overall compression ratios.
Silence a C compiler warning about an evil no-const cast.
Make compression size differences easily greppable for users.
Keep the loops a little simpler (and tighter) by calculating the hash values separately.

milestone.description: First feature release after the cleanup releases 3.0 and 3.1.

title: Compress module strings as concatenation
